abstract: In supposedly avoiding certain questions, a ministerial-exception case raises other, unanswerable ones.
snippet: In supposedly avoiding certain questions, a ministerial-exception case raises other, unanswerable ones.
lead_paragraph: The religion clause case recently argued before the Supreme Court - Hosanna-Tabor v. EEOC - centers on the "ministerial exception," the doctrine (elaborated over the last 40 years) that exempts religious associations from complying with neutral, generally applicable laws in some, but not all, circumstances.
